review: Pretty cool little box, except it is as limited as Amazon is arrogant.  The GUI is quick to navigate, yet again, it is for the most part wholly geared for Amazon only. I don't mind side-loading .apk files, but through an ADB bridge is tiresome and outdated.  I would have kept it, but the hardware failure made it completely unusable.

author: Amazon Customer

review: Almost there! I had been waiting for the Mad Katz STB to go down in price as I needed to replace several old Rokus. I mainly run Apple devices but they have lagged in a STB that will run apps.Since I buy almost all of my digital content from Amazon I thought why not try this.I was amazed at the performance and great UI. Streams Amazon without the constant reboots we got on the Roku even who a Roku 2. The other apps are decent and games... Wow. Haven't turned my Xbox on since getting it.Now the cons... First it is VERY disappointing that you can't expand the storage space. I would say that might be the only thing keeping me from keeping it long term or buying a few more for my family. The price point is nice to just slap on each TV. But 4 games and poof the storage is gone.Also some apps like Amazon Cloud Player are missing. Really? Very upsetting to miss my music. Also really want Spotify. Other than that the apps are what I needed.Finally... It is so hard to find Prime content. Yes you can but there really should be a category for it in the Nav like their app on Roku does.I hope a device like this can be my one and only STB because at the price getting a few years out of it and upgrading won't be painful like a huge game console. Plus you could even hide it behind a wall hung TV!
author: Vince Arter Jr.
